documents.document:
"American Idol" winner appears too close too cal

LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - "American Idol" fans waited with bated breath on Wednesday to see whether musical theater actor Adam Lambert or laid back acoustic guitarist Kris Allen will take home the coveted "Idol" title in the TV talent Shox_TR. show's eighth season.

Although Lambert went into Tuesday's three song apiece finale as the apparent front runner and was all but anointed the winner by judge Simon Cowell, the race appeared to be neck and neck.

Web site DialIdol.com, which tracks "Idol" voting trends by measuring the Pittsburgh_Steelers_jerseys number of calls to voting lines that result in busy signals, said the result was too close to call.

The Web site has accurately predicted the winners of "American Idol" in past seasons.

The results will be announced at the end of a two-hour finale ton Wednesday that will include performances by Carlos Santana, Cindy Lauper, Queen Latifah, Lionel Richie, Black Eyed Peas, and some surprise guests.

Lambert, 27, a showy Californian who wowed audiences throughout the season Air_jordan_XX . with his off-the-charts vocal range, was widely considered the favorite for the title and a recording contract heading into Tuesday's finale.

Cowell told him at the end of Tuesday's show. "The whole idea about doing a show like this is that you hope you can find a worldwide star -- I genuinely believe with all my heart that we have found that with you."

Cowell was less effusive with Allen, 23, saying that the low key Arkansan student had earned his spot in the finale and that his parents should be very proud of him.

His comments followed the performance by both contestants of an original song Air_jordan_20_shoes . co-written by new judge Kara DioGuardi that will become the winner's first single.

The song, called "No Boundaries," was clearly in too high a key for Allen's vocal range. Cowell also poked fun at the "mountains and hurricanes" in the song's lyrics.

"American Idol" began as a cheesy summer talent show in 2002 but quickly morphed into a cultural phenomenon that attracts tens of millions of viewers a week to News Corp's Fox network. Ratings have sagged about 7 percent this season, but it remains the nation's top-rated TV show with some 26 million viewers.

"Idol" has generated a long list of stars from its winners and losers, including Nike_Air_Foamposite .singers Kelly Clarkson, Carrie Underwood and Chris Daughtry and Oscar winner Jennifer Hudson.

http://www.reuters.com/article/televisionNews/idUSTRE54J6WV20090520
jordan_basketball_shoes_XV
jordan_basketball_shoes_XVI .

Back in Finals, Lakers Look to Finish the Job

A modest celebration swept across the Pepsi Center floor and down the corridor leading to the visitors’ locker room late

Friday night. The Los Angeles Lakers had just been crowned Western Conference champions, and had the T-shirts, hats and a

trophy to prove it.

But the celebration was subdued, and it ended atAir_jordan_V_sneaker.

the locker-room door. Inside, only one player still wore the commemorative T-shirt. Nearly everyone wore

painfully serious expressions.

“There’s no satisfaction in this locker room at all,” the veteran Derek Fisher said.

For a franchise steeped in championships, the minor trophies, however shiny, rarely provide much comfort.

It has been seven years since the Lakers last embraced the Max_Tempo_2_Duke_Blue_Devils . Larry O’Brien Trophy, and 347 days since they

were crushed by the Boston Celtics in the 2008 finals. That series ended in a humiliating Game 6 rout, and criticism rained

like confetti on their shoulders. The Lakers left TD Banknorth Garden soaked in frustration and anger. The feelings never

waned.

“We started training camp Sept. 30, we were still frustrated, still angry,” Fisher said.

Redemption is now in reach, after a sometimes-difficult six-game Western Conference finals against the Denver Nuggets. The

Lakers appear more capable than ever of claiming the franchise’s 15th title.

They won the last two games of the series in impressive fashion, using an efficient, well-balanced offense and some

relentless defense. Their 119-92 series-clinching victory Friday was as complete a game as they have played in the

postseason.

The final step is typically the toughest, but the Lakers feel better prepared for it. They were pushed to the limit by the

Houston Rockets in a seven-game semifinal series. They absorbed every blow that the physical Nuggets threw at them. Last

year, they breezed through the Western Conference playoffs with a 12-3 Air_jordan_XXIII .record. But the Lakers insist the harder path is the

better one.

“Much, much tougher,” Kobe Bryant said. “Mentally challenging for us. But we gained valuable experience, went through a

roller coaster of emotions.”

Trevor Ariza offered a startling admission, saying, “We were happy just to be there last year.” They return to the finals

more seasoned. “This year we know what to expect, we know what we have to do,” he said.

Whether they face Orlando or Cleveland, the Lakers will present a different look from what they had last June.

Andrew Bynum, their sturdy young center, is healthy now, after missing jordan_basketballhoes_6_ring the 2008 postseason

after knee surgery. A broken foot left Ariza limited last spring. He has since blossomed into a top-notch defender and 3-

point shooter, and is starting at small forward.

“It feels great to be able to be back and actually being able to be an active participant,” said Bynum, the lone Laker who

was — understandably — still wearing his white Western Conference champions T-shirt in the locker room Friday night.

The Lakers were accused of lacking toughness against the Celtics. Bynum and Ariza provide an extra layer of it.

“Andrew, even though people at times question him, he’s continued to make sacrifices physically that at times other guys

aren’t,” Fisher said. “He’s taken some good, hard, quality fouls that,New_York_Jets_jerseys . to be honest, put him into foul trouble and

force him to go sit on the bench. But he’s not giving up easy baskets in there.”

The Lakers will continue to rise and fall with Bryant, one of the N.B.A.’s most lethal and complete offensive players, who

is averaging 29.6 points, 5.3 rebounds and 4.9 assists in the playoffs. Their downfall last June was widely regarded as a

failure of his supporting cast, notably Pau Gasol and Lamar Odom.

But both came through in the final two games of the conference finals, providing some reassurance. Gasol and Odom combined

for 33 points, 24 rebounds and 9 blocks in Game 5, then came back with 40 points and 20 rebounds in Game 6.

“I think we learned a lesson, and we’re going to keep it this way,” Gasol said.

The Nuggets were left with impossible decisions on whom to double-team, and were left “a little out of balance” (Gasol’s

words) as Bryant, Odom and Gasol took turns carving up the Nuggets with Nike_Men_Air_Force_1_High . their passing.

The Nuggets had played the Lakers to a 2-2 draw in the series before Odom and Gasol clicked into place.

“I saw little cracks in the Lakers,” Nuggets Coach George Karl said, “and somehow we’ve cemented those cracks back up.

And I think they’re the best team right now in the N.B.A.”

By wrapping up the conference finals Friday, the Lakers earned a six-day break before the finals begin. Odom, who has a large

contusion on his lower back, stands to benefit the most. Bryant, who played more than 86 minutes in the last two games and

acknowledged having some fatigue, could use the rest.

When he was not filling up the box score Friday, Bryant was thumping Air_jordan_VI_sneaker . teammates on the chest, grabbing them by

the ears and generally exhorting them to give everything they had to close out the series. The only one shouting louder and

more often was Fisher.

The decade began with Lakers dominance — three championships from 2000 to 2002. Bryant and Fisher are the only holdovers,

and they carry both the pride and the burden of trying to rekindle the greatness. They have been back to the finals twice,

only to be smacked down by Detroit in 2004 and Boston in 2008.

Bryant is still seeking his first title without Shaquille O’Neal. Coach Phil Jackson is still seeking the 10th ring that

will push him past Red Auerbach for the most in league history.

Fisher, his stern look never softening, said he had to impress upon the jordan_basketball_shoes_10.5 .younger Lakers just how

precious their opportunity is.

“What we’ve been through since 2004, and then to get back there last year and not get it done again, I don’t know if guys

fully understand the frustration or the pain that comes with that, when you’re not sure if it’s ever going to happen again,

” he said. “I think all of our guys are excited about it, though, to have a chance to kind of right what we felt was wrong.

”

Braves get McLouth from Pirates

ATLANTA -- The Braves acquired All-Star center fielder Nate McLouth from the Pittsburgh Pirates for three minor leaguers on

Wednesday, a move to beef up Atlanta's offense in hopes of contending in the NL East.

The 27-year-old McLouth was an All-Star last season and set career highs with a .276 average, 26 homers and 94 RBIs. The

Braves desperately needed more offense from an outfield that New_York_Giants_jerseys .produced only 10 homers through the first 51 games.

Atlanta gave up outfielder Gorkys Hernandez, one of their top prospects, along with pitchers Charlie Morton and Jeff Locke.

McLouth, who is hitting .256 with nine homers and 34 RBIs this season, fills several needs for the Braves. In addition to

bolstering the lineup, he won a Gold Glove in 2008 and had 23 stolen bases. Since the start of the '05 season, he has the

best stolen base percentage (64 of 69) among all major Shox_Go .leaguers.

Another plus: McLouth is under contract through at least 2011, having signed a three-year, $15.75 contract in spring

training. The deal includes a team option for a fourth year at $10.65 million, with a buyout of $1.25 million.

"He gives us everything we're looking for," general manager Frank Wren said. "He gives us an extra outfield bat. He gives us

speed. He gives us defense. He brings a lot to the table."

It was a day of big moves for Atlanta. The trade was announced jordan_basketball_shoes_2.5 .less than an hour after the

Braves released 305-game winner Tom Glavine, saying they didn't feel the 43-year-old had shown during three minor league

rehab assignments that he could still be effective in the big leagues.

Instead, the team called up highly touted prospect Tommy Hanson, who has dominated at Triple-A Gwinnett and will make his

first major league appearance on Saturday against the Milwaukee Brewers.

"We didn't want the season to get too far gone before we made some moves," Wren said. "We thought some aggressive moves would

put our club in good position."

The Braves went into Wednesday's contest against the Chicago Air_jordan_3.5.
Cubs trailing the East-leading Philadelphia Phillies by 4½ games. Atlanta hasn't made the playoffs since 2005, the

last of their record 14 straight division titles.

By trading McLouth, Pittsburgh cleared a spot for one of its best prospects, former first-round pick Andrew McCutchen. He was

called up from Triple-A Indianapolis, where he was hitting .303 with four homers, 20 RBIs and 10 stolen bases.

Pirates general manager Neal Huntington said trading Air_jordan_VI_ring.
McLouth "may be the toughest decision we have made in my time with the organization."

"Nate is a quality player and person," Huntington said. "But as we have said several times, tough decisions will need to be

made as we build and sustain a championship-caliber organization. Nate has worked as hard as any player to become a starting

major league player, proving wrong anyone who may have doubted him.

Power surge propels Mariners in finale

SEATTLE -- Powerball was the name of the game for the Mariners in their series finale against the Twins on Sunday afternoon.

Russell Branyan, Jose Lopez and Jamie Nike_jordan_shoes_18 . Burke hit home runs, leading the Mariners to a 4-2 victory before 37,714 at Safeco Field.

Branyan hit his 13th home run of the season, a towering blast that cleared the fence in straightaway center field, Lopez slugged his sixth home run of the season Orlando_Magic.htmlto start the fifth inning, and four batters later, Burke KO'd Twins starter Kevin Slowey with a solo shot to left field.

It was Burke's first home run of the season, which includes 16 at-bats with the Mariners and 34 with Triple-A Tacoma. He now has three homers in 355 MLB at-bats.

Seattle had a chance to pad its first two-run lead, loading the bases with two outs in the fourth inning. Ichiro Suzuki walked, Branyan singled and Adrian UGG_Sandra .Beltre was hit by a pitch, setting up a crowd-pleasing at-bat for Ken Griffey Jr.

His 16th career grand slam would have produced a 6-0 lead. But he grounded out to second.

The Twins took advantage, jordan_3.5_sneaker .scoring two runs off left-hander Erik Bedard in the fifth despite having one hit, to tie the game at 2. Bedard walked Denard Span leading off and surrendered a double to Joe Mauer. An infield out from the bat of Justin Morneau scored Air_jordan_IX_sneaker . one run and sacrifice fly by Joe Crede the other.

But the home runs by Lopez and Burke in the bottom of the inning put the Mariners ahead to stay and presented Bedard with his first career victory against the Twins. He had been 0-5.

For newspapers, more bad news: Online ad revenue is plummeti

For years, even after the economy began to buckle under the weight of a recession, online advertising revenue remained

relatively strong. But a new study, jordan_10.5_sneaker .released on Friday, shows that fiscal malaise has finally – and fully – struck the digital sphere.

According to the Interactive Advertising Bureau and PricewaterhouseCoopers, online ad revenue in the US market sank to $5.5

billion in the Nike_jordan_shoes_2009 .first quarter of

2009, down 5 percent from $6.1 billion in the fourth quarter of last year. It is the first major slump of its kind since the

burst of the dot-com bubble in 2002. (Revenue levels dipped – although not this drastically – in 2008.)

The news could be especially troubling for magazines and newspapers, which have increasingly turned to the web to make up for

the loss of print ad nike air shox Over the past few months, many outlets have

shuttered or cut back on their print operations. In February, The Rocky nike air force Mountain News, the oldest newspaper in Colorado, ceased printing, and in March, the Seattle Post-Intelligencer shut

its presses.

Remaining papers, such ugg boots as the Boston Globe, have struggled to deal with declining

print ad revenue – much of it lost to Craigslist, and other classified sites – while shifting to a web-centric marketing

strategy. (In April, the Christian Science Monitor began publishing its daily edition online only.)

An uptick on the NFL Jerseys horizon?

Despite the gloomy numbers, Randall Rothenberg, IAB’s CEO, said there was some cause for hope. “We’re confident that

growth will resume as the U.S. economic climate improves,” Rothenberg said. “Interactive advertising is the most

accountable way to reach Jordan basketball shoes consumers – and in this economy,

digital media will be a core component of any successful marketing campaign.”

David Silverman, a partner Air jordan at PricewaterhouseCoopers, concurred. “Current

economic conditions are clearly challenging,” he told the BBC today. “Nonetheless, interactive media continues to consume a

larger piece of the overall advertising pie.”

Brazil Finds More Bodies From Air France Crash Site

SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--A Brazilian military rescue mission found a total of 41 bodies from the site of a crashed Air France

flight bound for Indianapolis_Colts_Jerseys .Paris last week,

the country's director of Air Traffic Control, or Decea, said Tuesday during a televised press conference.

Air Force official Ramon Borges Cardoso, Decea's director, said 25 bodies were being shipped by boat and helicopter to

Fernando de Shox_Basketball .Noronha island in Brazil's northeast.

Air France flight number 447 broke up over the Atlantic Ocean last week when it encountered violent storms that allegedly

caused a jordan_basketball_shoes_VIII. series of

systemic failures on board.

The flight was carrying 228 passengers. The rescue mission is ongoing.

France, Brazil and the U.S. have said there are no signs that terrorism was involved in the crash.

Tight hamstring causes Morton's exit

ATLANTA -- Charlie Morton's anticipated Pirates debut lasted only one inning against the Braves on Wednesday, as he had to be

removed from the show_winter07_monogram_olympe .scoreless

game after the first because of tightness in his right hamstring.

The right-hander, who Pittsburgh acquired a week ago as part of a four-player trade that sent Nate McLouth to the Braves,

informed the Pirates that he felt some tightness in the hamstring before the start. He still took the mound in the first --

throwing 13 pitches in a nike dunk shoes scoreless frame -- but was unable to return.

Morton was replaced by Jeff Karstens, who was initially scheduled to pitch on Wednesday before the Pirates handed that fifth

rotation spot to Morton. nike air force 1 Karstens threw 18 pitches in relief during

Monday's 15-inning game, but will not be on any sort of pitch limit as he pitches deep into Wednesday's game against the

Braves.

Financial Officer Is Hired by Yahoo

SUNNYVALE, Calif. (AP) — Yahoo has lured a chief financial officer away from the Altera Corporation to fill a crucial role

in its new management team.

The company said Nike_Air_Force_1_Mid .Thursday that it had hired

Tim Morse from Altera, a chip maker based in San Jose, Calif., not far from Yahoo’s base in Sunnyvale. Mr. Morse became

Altera’s chief financial officer in 2007 after spending 15 years in various positions at General Electric.

The hiring of Mr. Morse ends Yahoo’s three-and-a-half-month search for a successor to its current chief financial officer,

Blake Jorgensen, New_Orleans_Saints_jerseys .who announced

his plans to leave a few weeks after the company hired Carol Bartz as its new chief executive.

Mr. Jorgensen, who will depart with a $1.8 million severance package, is set to become chief financial officer of the jeans

maker Levi Strauss & Company on July 1.Shox_Q'Vida .

Mr. Morse, 40, will start at Yahoo with a $500,000 salary, up from the $375,000 he was getting at Altera. Yahoo is also

paying him a $500,000 signing bonus, 400,000 shares of stock options and 150,000 shares of restricted stock.

Elgin garbage truck driver saves American flags

ELGIN, Ill. - Suburban Chicago veterans have honored a garbage truck driver who's credited with saving 250 American flags

from being improperly thrown out within the last 18 months.

Elgin's American Legion Post 57 and Elks Lodge 737 recognized Waste Management driver Jeff Olsen during a Flag Day ceremony

Sunday.Nike_jordan_20.

Olsen is a 34-year-old native Canadian who says he plucks flags from the refuse in his truck whenever he sees them. Waste

Management representatives say that has been a regular practice among their Elgin drivers for some time, but Olsen is the

most Jordan_melo_1.5_shoes .successful.

Olsen is married to a former Army medic who did two tours of duty in Kuwait. He says that throwing flags away is like

stomping on them.
Federal code says American flags should be discarded in a dignified way.

Gas prices highest in California and S.F.

Gas prices in California topped $3 a gallon, the highest in the nation, according to AAA, and San Francisco has the highest

prices in the state, coming in at $3.09 per gallon.

According to AAA’s fuel gauge report for Monday, the average price for a gallon of regular unleaded gas in California is

just over $3. A Nike_air_jordan_9. medium grade fuel will cost you

$3.20 per gallon, while premium costs more than $3.25.

San Francisco reports prices of $3.09, $3.29 and $3.34 for the three grades, more than any other metropolitan region in the

state.

In the Sacramento region, drivers are paying $2.96 per gallon for regular grade, $3.15 for middle grade, and $3.20 for

premium.

A year ago, those prices Nike_air_jordan_14_shoes. were all

well above $4.50 per gallon (that’s $4.55 today, after reckoning for inflation), and over $5 in some places.

Prices all over the state are at or near $3 per gallon — at $2.89, Yuba City is cheapest. AAA’s highest recorded average

gas prices for the state all occurred in June of last year.

Cubs, White Sox rained out, makeup date could come in Septem

By Dave van Dyck

Tuesday's Cubs-White Sox game was rained out at Wrigley Field with no makeup date set, although the teams only have games

here the next two days and are not expected to play a doubleheader then.

The game could be made up in September. Both teams have open dates on Sept. 3 and Sept. 10, with the first being the more

likely option.

It was the first rainout ever for the intra-city interleague games since they started counting in the standings in 1997. Two

games have been shortened by rain.

The White Sox announced that Tuesday's starter John Danks would now start Wednesday afternoon and be followed by Gavin Floyd

on Thursday. Nike AIR Force That leaves Jose Contreras out of the mix for the Cubs.

The Cubs will throw Ryan Dempster on Wednesday night and Carlos Zambrano Thursday, meaning he will have an extra day of rest.

Rookie Randy Wells is being skipped.

Apple MobileMe Debuts Find My iPhone, Data-Wipe Services

Apple on Wednesday launched the Find My iPhone and remote data-wipe services for its popular smartphone on MobileMe, the

company's online file-sharing service.

The new capabilities are available on iPhones that have been upgraded to the latest 3.0 software. The platform was released

this month, Jordan_XXI_shoes. along with the introduction of the new

iPhone 3G S, at Apple's World Wide Developers Conference. The latest smartphone is set for release June 19.
The new Find My IPhone feature for MobileMe subscribers makes it possible for them to find a lost phone on a map and to send

a message or alert to the device that will play even if the smartphone is in silent mode. If the device can't be recovered

because its been stolen or for some other reason, then the owner can use MobileMe to remotely wipe out all the data. The

deletion can Nike_air_jordan_19. be undone if the owner later

recovers the device.

In launching the new capabilities, Apple warned that high traffic may make the services temporarily unavailable. Indeed, the

Find My iPhone and Remote Wipe page on MobileMe were intermittently down on Wednesday, Apple enthusiast site AppleInsider

reported. Nike_air_jordan_17_shoes.

People looking to test the services sometimes received the service: "MobileMe Account is currently unavailable. We apologize

for this service interruption and are working hard to resolve the problem," AppleInsider said. The delay appeared to have

cleared up by Nike_Men_Dunk_High. midday.

While not exclusively an enterprise feature, Remote Wipe will certainly be welcomed by businesspeople who use their iPhone on

the job. air_jordan_17. In general, mobile security experts

say the 3.0 software is a significant improvement for the platform, but it still lacks features available in handsets more

geared toward business.

UAW Names A GM Director

DETROIT -- The trustees for a health care fund for retired General Motors auto workers picked a close union advisor and auto industry expert to join GM's board of directors.

Stephen J. Girsky will represent the Voluntary Employee Beneficiary Association's interest in GM when it completes its government-brokered Nike_Men_Air_Force_1_High . bankruptcy reorganization. Under terms of the largely pre-arranged deal, the VEBA will own 17.5% of the new General Motors ( GMGMQ.PK - news - people ) and has the right to appoint one director, with the UAW's consent.

Former AT&T ( T - news - people ) chief Edward Whitacre will be chairman of the new GM, which will be 70% owned by the U.S. Treasury Nike_jordan_22 . and the Canadian and Ontario governments. About half of GM's board is being replaced.

Girsky has 20 years of automotive industry experience and is intimately knowledgeable with GM's affairs, having served as a special advisor to former GM chief executive, G. Richard Wagoner from August 2005 to June 2006. More recently, he brokered a deal to Shox_Energia .sell GM's Saturn division to auto dealer and former racecar driver Roger Penske. In recent years, he has also served as an advisor to UAW President Ronald Gettelfinger.

When Girsky left GM in 2006, he became president of the industrial unit of Centerbridge Partners, L.P., a private investment firm that Nike_air_jordan2.5_shoes .purchased Dana Corp., a Toledo, Ohio, auto supplier. He currently serves on Dana's board of directors. Prior to joining GM, Girsky was a long-time auto industry analyst at Morgan Stanley ( MS - news - people ).

Missing Hiker Walks Out of Cascade Mountains Unharmed

MARBLEMOUNT, Wash. — A hiker missing for more than three days in North Cascades National Park has been found. He walked to

the trailhead Nike_Women_Air_Force_1_Low_Mid_High .
on his own Sunday afternoon.

National Park spokeswoman Kerry Olson says Mark Albrecht is cold and hungry but otherwise unhurt.

The 22-year-old, who had recently moved to Everett from Indiana, had a permit to camp in the Cascade Pass area Monday and

Tuesday nights. Shox_TL_4 .He never called his parents to say he got home

safely, and he didn't show up for work on Thursday.

Rangers found his car Friday evening at a trailhead, and began searching first thing Saturday.

Olson says park officials are finding out what happened to Albrecht and how he found his way out. But she says he's just

fine.

MBA expects fewer home loans

The Mortgage Bankers Association is revising downward its 2009 forecast for loan originations.

The industry group now expects mortgage originations this year of $2.03 trillion, down more than $700 billion from what it

was forecasting in March Nike_Men_Air_Force_1_Low.
The MBA said $84 billion of the drop is the result of fewer home purchases and the rest is due to fewer refinancings.

The MBA now expects existing home sales in 2009 will be 4.8 million units, a drop of 1.2 percent from 2008, and new home

sales to be 352,000 units, down about 27 percent
Nike_jordan_21.

It expects the median price for new and existing homes will continue to fall about 10 percent from 2008 levels, but leveling

off in 2010 as the economy improves.

Last week, the MBA reported that the number of mortgage and refinancing applications had fallen for the fourth consecutive

week, while mortgage rates dipped slightly for 30-year and 15-year fixed rates.

Is September upgrade time for the iPod Touch?

Fans of the iPod Touch who felt left out due to last week's launch of the iPhone 3G S take heart: You've got a new device on the way Nike_Women_Air_Force_1_Low_Mid_H igh. In the BlueTool initialization script in the iPhone 3.0 firmware there are mentions of a new iPod Touch called "iPod3,1." Given that the current generation is referred to as "iPod2,1," this indicates Apple has a new version in the works.

It's too soon to say what the new iPod Touch will look like or feature, but rumors point to a camera that takes video as being a Nike_jordan_19. likely edition. Other rumors indicate a larger screen, new wireless features, a digital compass, and GPS.

While fans would love to see more iPhone-like functionality in the new device Apple has to make sure it doesn't give too much away: make the iPod too much like the iPhone then it takes away much of the reason to buy an iPhone.

Apple's Shox_Disobey .last upgrade to the Touch line came last September, thus it would seem reasonable to assume that the next one would be this coming September. Being that it's an Apple product you can be sure more info will slowly come out in the months to come.

Iraq confirms first cases of H1N1 flu virus

minister confirmed on Wednesday the country's first cases of the H1N1 flu virus, saying seven members of the women's national

basketball team were being treated in hospital.

The squad had been playing in a championships in Chicago and returned to Iraq on June 20.

"Today, six cases of this epidemic flu, H1N1, have been diagnosed in our ministry's central lab," Health Minister Saleh Al-

Hasnawi told a news conference Shox_2-45 .

Six were being treated in hospital in Iraq. One, who was detected as having the virus when the team passed through Jordan, is

being treated there. All the patients were in good condition, the minister said.

Hasnawi said one member of the U.S.-led multinational military force in Iraq had also been confirmed on Wednesday as having

the H1N1 virus, but he gave no further details Nike air jordan shoes

The H1N1 virus has spread around the globe and the World Health Organisation has declared an influenza pandemic and advised

governments to prepare for a long-term battle it.

There have been more than 50,000 confirmed cases of the virus and at least 237 people have died. (Reporting by Aseel Kami;

Editing by Daniel Wallis and Jon Boyle)

Share Your Michael Jackson Memories

Michael Jackson reportedly died Thursday at 50 after paramedics rushed the erstwhile King of Pop to a Los Angeles hospital.

In recent years, NBA Jerseys his prodigious talent had been overshadowed by a personal life

fraught with court cases, financial distress and -- it must be said -- an element of the absurd as the reclusive singer

withdrew further into a world in which his three children wore veils in public and the man himself was rarely seen. All that

seemed on the verge of changing as Jackson prepped to kick off a series of concerts in London on July 13 -- his first in

several years.

His very rise to Nike Air Jodan stardom -- from chart dominance to glitter-covered glove

to Bubbles the chimp to Blanket the baby -- defined the dual nature of celebrity and its ability to both venerate and

eviscerate.

But many of us have indelible good memories of Jackson that predate the court cases, the surgery, the baffling behavior. For

me, he conjures images of junior high school dances punctuated with gawky moonwalks, the anticipation of waiting for his 13-

minute long "Thriller" video to finally premiere on MTV in 1983 and always, always as the bright-eyed smiling kid who had the

charisma to lead his Jordan_V_sneaker . brothers up the charts as

the frontman of the Jackson 5.

Share your memories of Michael Jackson here and what, if anything, you plan to do to mark his passing. Does one of Jackson's

songs resonate for you or perfectly crystallize a moment of your life? I'll be checking back throughout the evening to

moderate.

U.S. gasoline prices hover around $2.66/gallon: survey

NEW YORK (Reuters) - The average price of a gallon of gasoline in the United States remained virtually unchanged from two

weeks ago as crude oil prices hovered at about $70 per barrel, according to an industry analyst.

The national average for self-serve, regular unleaded gas was nearly $2.6613 a gallon on June 26, while two weeks ago it cost

$2.6607, Air_Jordan_melo_1.5. according to the nationwide Lundberg

survey of gas stations.

The stability was mostly a function of oil price inertia, according to survey editor Trilby Lundberg. The price of crude oil

per barrel hovered in a narrow range of about $69 to $71 in the past two weeks, Lundberg said in an interview on Sunday.

"It comes down to crude as usual," Lundberg said. "There is not going to be a demand surge any time soon because of poor

economic conditions Nike_jordan_shoes_6_ring.
The average price for gasoline was well below the June 20, 2008, price of about $4.097 per gallon, but Lundberg noted that

lower prices would not be enough to send people to the pumps as unemployment numbers stay high.

"That price discount of a $1.44 is large but so is the number of motorists who are barely motoring at all," Lundberg said.

"The upcoming July Fourth holiday (is) hardly a point at all," she said, noting that most people commonly use gasoline to

drive to work and back .Dennis_Rodman .

"Only a reversal in employment levels would revitalize gasoline demand," Lundberg said.

At $2.40 per gallon, Wichita, Kansas, had the lowest average price for self-serve, regular unleaded gas, while San Francisco

had the highest price at $3.02 per gallon.

The Associated Press
Monday, June 29, 2009; 8:24 PM

after she expressed concerns about the control of his business deals and bank accounts.

Northeast U.S., So Far Spared, Could Still Face Home Price P

By JOHN JANNARONE
For many U.S. homeowners, crisis hasn't meant urgency. Just as potential buyers have waited, many would-be sellers facing paper losses have not been forced to act. The standoff shouldn't be confused with stability.

The housing freefall slowed in April. Prices dropped 18.1% year on year, according to S&P/Case-Shiller's index of 20 cities. They were lower in every city, but economists were encouraged by slightly more modest declines compared with March -- a possible Air jordan 10.5 sneaker sign the market is near a bottom.

In some overbuilt cities, foreclosures have helped clear inventory while rapidly bringing prices back to reality. Phoenix and Las Vegas, for instance, have seen prices fall back nearly to 2000 levels.

But markets like Boston and New York, where prices rose during the boom, albeit not as drastically as the Sun Belt, have slid much slower. Prices in Boston are still 48% above 2000 levels and New York's prices are 71% higher. Valuations in both cities are only Nike air jordan melo 1.5 about 20% off their peaks.

Would-be sellers in the Northeast appear to be taking their time. There, the inventory of homes for sale has increased just 17% since the end of 2005, before the market bubble burst, according to the Census Bureau. In the West, meanwhile, inventories have risen 74% over the same time period.

Transaction volumes tell a similar story. The National Association of Realtors says existing home sales in the Northeast fell 10% year Nike Men Dunk Mid on year in April, while they increased 17% in the West.

Home prices in the less overbuilt Northeast are unlikely to correct as sharply as in some other markets. But further pain has likely been delayed, not avoided.

Facebook Simplifies Privacy Settings

Facebook plans to streamline its privacy settings to give users more control over the information they share.
In a blog post on Wednesday, chief privacy officer Chris Kelly said Facebook is in the process of simplifying and

standardizing its privacy settings.

For Facebook users , Air jordan XVII sneaker this means

revisiting previous privacy choices. Over the next few weeks, Facebook plans to make a Transition Tool available that will

ask users to specify their desired level of information sharing. Previous privacy choices will carry over to the new privacy

settings. Whether users will migrate toward more or less openness remains to be seen.
"We think Facebook is most useful when people can find and connect with each other, which is why this tool will enable you to

make available those parts of your profile that you feel comfortable sharing in order to facilitate better connection," said

Kelly . Nike air jordan XVIII "You will have the choice of being

as open or as limited in the sharing of this information as you want."

Facebook, however, seems to be encouraging its users to be less protective about their information, because private

information can't be monetized. In March, it added an "Everyone" option -- an option not previously available -- to encourage

broad information sharing.

During a media conference call about the changes, Facebook VP of communications and public policy Elliot Schrage responded to

the suggestion that Facebook appeared to be encouraging information sharing by saying that the company was trying to manage

the tension Nike Men Dunk Low between privacy and openness.

Facebook hasn't managed that tension very well in recent years as efforts to monetize the free service have led to privacy

oversights. Its Beacon social advertising scheme, for example, created considerable controversy in 2007 for violating user

privacy. The uproar eventually prompted an apology from CEO Mark Zuckerberg and a shift to an opt-in system.

But lately, Facebook seems to be stepping through the privacy minefield with more self-assurance.

more and register.

Stocks Post Small Gains After Three-Week Slump

Stock markets eked out a gain today following a three-week slump.

The blue-chip Dow Jones industrial average rose 44.13 points, or 0.5 percent, to 8324.87, while the broader Standard & Poor's

500-stock index gained 2.3, or 0.2 percent, to 898.72. But tech stocks dragged the Nasdaq down 9.12 points, 0 0.5 percent, to

1,787.40. The major indexes have fallen for the past three weeks, the longest streak of declines since the markets bottomed

out in March. Air Jordan 22
A report released this morning by the Institute for Supply Management showed that the non-manufacturing sector contracted for

the ninth consecutive month in June, albeit at a slower rate. The trade group's index of activity in service industries was

at 47 in June, 3 points higher than in May. Any reading above 50 indicates growth; any reading below 50 indicates

contraction. Six sectors reported growth, while 11 contracted in June, according to the organization.

The report was the latest indication that the nation's economic recovery remains ephemeral, even if the worst may be over.

Last week, Nike Men Dunk Low investors balked at weaker-than-

expected labor reports showing the number of jobs on employers' payrolls fell by 467,000 in June while the unemployment rate

rose to 9.5 percent, sending stock markets into a tailspin.

Oil prices have risen sharply in recent months, though they moderated before the holiday weekend. Light, sweet crude for

August delivery slipped to a five-week low today, settling at $64.34 on the New York Mercantile Exchange, down $2.39, or

about 4 percent.

Stocks were also down overseas. London's FTSE 100 dropped 1 percent, or 41 points, to 4195. In Asia, Japan's Nikkei 225

declined 1.4 percent, or 135 points, to 9681, while Hong Kong's Hang Seng index dipped 1.2 percent, or 224 points, to 17,979.

Questions Remain in Jackson's Death

Michael Jackson was never far from the spotlight when he was alive, but now the whereabouts of his body are a growing

mystery, reports CBS News correspondent Ben Tracy.

The casket was on display at the memorial service Tuesday, but the Jackson family is now closely guarding its location and

does not yet want the public to know when or where Michael Jackson will be laid to rest, opening the possibility that it

could still be Air Jordan 11 at Neverland, the singer's famed ranch.

Meanwhile, the coroner's office is running tests on portions of his brain, hoping to determine whether he had any underlying

condition, such as a tumor, that contributed to his death.

"This is being done to rule out disease and ultimately the toxicology report will tell us definitively as to why Mr. Jackson

died," said Dr. Lawrence Kobilinsky, with the John Jay College of Criminal Justice.

The death certificate lists the cause of death as "deferred." The toxicology report may show whether prescription painkillers

played any role in Jackson's death. But experts say Diprivan, a powerful anesthesia drug, allegedly used as a sleep aid by

the singer , Air jordan XVI sneaker is often hard to detect

on routine toxicology tests.

"You have to send urine and potentially blood and potentially hair to very specialized laboratories," said Dr. Paul

Wischmeyer, a Diprivan expert.

The shrine to Jackson at his parents' home was dismantled today. Also Wednesday, the Web site TMZ.com, which first broke the

news of Jackson's death, reports that the Jackson family gave investigators a list of doctors who may have been

overprescribing medication for Michael Jackson. It reportedly includes Dr. Arnold Klein, Jackson's longtime dermatologist. On

"Good Morning Nike air jordan XVI America," he said he is not one

of the five doctors thought to be targeted by the investigation.

"I was not one of the doctors who participated in giving him overdoses of drugs or too much of anything," Klein said. "In

fact, I was the one who limited everything, who stopped everything."

Meanwhile, a custody hearing for Jackson's three children will take place on Monday. It is not clear whether Debbie Rowe,

Jackson's ex-wife, will fight Jackson's mother Catherine for custody.
